items.title: 'Kees Smit moet vaker naar de gym'
items.summary: Cijferman Bart Frouws vertelt je in Scorebordjournalistiek wat er opvalt richting speelronde 17 van de Eredivisie. Samen met Sjoerd Keizer bespreekt hij deze keer AZ √©n de ruwe diamant Kees Smit.

items.title: Arsenal opnieuw koploper met kerst: 'Vertrouwen dat we nu w√©l titel pakken'
items.summary: Arsenal gaat na de zege op Everton voor de derde keer in vier jaar als koploper de kerst in. De vorige drie keren leidde dit niet tot een landstitel, maar Arsenal-manager Mikel Arteta heeft het vertrouwen dat dit nu wel gaat gebeuren. 'Ons niveau en de constantie van dit team geeft mij dat geloof.'

items.title: VI Live: Feyenoord hoopt zich thuis tegen FC Twente te herpakken
items.summary: Feyenoord krijgt zondag bezoek van FC Twente. De Rotterdammers verloren drie wedstrijden op rij en azen dus op eerherstel. Zeker na de bekerexit van deze week tegen SC Heerenveen. Volg het duel met FC Twente in deze VI Live.

items.title: ‚ÄòI made such a bond‚Äô: Jesse Lingard on life in South Korea and his next challenge
items.summary: Former Manchester United player discusses culinary and cultural surprises, feeling more mature and how he learned Korean Jesse Lingard says his Korean is decent, good enough to make himself understood when out for dinner and the shocks do not stop there. The former Manchester United and England midfielder was always going to throw himself into his K-League adventure with FC Seoul and now that it is over after two years, a new chapter beckoning when the January transfer window opens, the 33-year-old certainly has the tales to tell. It was the little things as much as anything else, the cultural quirks. And the bigger ones, of course ‚Äì such as the time he watched an octopus squirm in front of him before eating it. ‚ÄúThe food is different, obviously, and I tried live octopus,‚Äù Lingard says. ‚ÄúIt was moving. I was scared at first but it was all right.‚Äù Continue reading...

items.title: ‚ÄòWe feel excluded‚Äô: expensive tickets and Trump‚Äôs shadow dampen World Cup excitement in Mexico
items.summary: The feeling among fans is anticlimatic as ‚Äòbusinessmen have appropriated the ball that used to belong to the people‚Äô Jonathan Zamora was seven years old the last time Mexico hosted the World Cup in 1986. ‚ÄúI witnessed perhaps one of the most sublime moments in the history of football,‚Äù he says, retelling a story that has become a pillar of his life. Zamora, a Mexican football fan, does not remember how his father, Antonio, got tickets to the 1986 World Cup quarter-final between Argentina and England at the Azteca Stadium in Mexico City. But he does clearly remember the goals: first when Diego Maradona used his ‚Äúhand of God‚Äù to push the ball past England goalkeeper Peter Shilton. And then the ‚Äúgoal of the century‚Äù, where the Argentinian went on a slalom run, dribbling past half the England team before scoring. Continue reading...

items.title: De eeuwige liefde van Alexander B√ºttner: 'Vitesse is zoveel meer dan een club'
items.summary: Vitesse was dood en begraven, maar √©√©n speler weigerde om de club de rug toe te keren: Alexander B√ºttner. De 36-jarige aanvoerder staat symbool voor de wonderlijke wederopstanding van de Arnhemmers. Aan het einde van een hectisch jaar doet de Doetinchemmer zijn verhaal aan de hand van zijn vijf gezichten.

items.title: Bears stun Packers for overtime win, brawl mars end to Eagles' title clincher
items.summary: Caleb Williams threw a 46-yard touchdown pass to DJ Moore in overtime, and the Chicago Bears overcame a 10-point deficit late in the fourth quarter Saturday night for a 22-16 win over the Green Bay Packers, who lost quarterback Jordan Love to a concussion.

items.title: AJ: I had to decide if I wanted to carry on boxing
items.summary: Anthony Joshua admits he needed time to decide if he wanted to carry on boxing after his knockout defeat to Daniel Dubois in 2024. The answer? He does.

items.title: 'I didn't get that right' - McCullum admits error on England Ashes preparation
items.summary: Brendon McCullum has accepted responsibility for not getting England's Ashes preparation right after his side lost the third Test and succumbed to a series defeat to Australia in just 11 days of cricket..

items.title: 'Luke is a different breed' - The NHS worker looking to upset Littler
items.summary: David Davies says Luke Littler is a ‚Äúdifferent breed‚Äù but is hoping to cause a major upset when the pair meet in the second round of the World Darts Championship on Sunday night.

items.summary: Kylian Mbapp√© added his name to another line in the record books on Saturday, tying Cristiano Ronaldo for the most goals by a Real Madrid player in a calendar year.

items.title: Arteta: Arsenal unfazed by Man City title charge
items.summary: Mikel Arteta said Arsenal were not distracted by Manchester City moving top of the Premier League before the Gunners reclaimed number one spot hours later with a 1-0 win at Everton.

items.title: 'I'm not a clown': Sevilla boss blasts red-card ref
items.summary: Sevilla coach Matias Almeyda blasted referee Alejandro Mu√±iz after being shown a half-time red card during the team's 2-0 LaLiga defeat at Real Madrid, saying "I'm not a clown in a circus."

items.title: Isak injured while scoring in Liverpool win at Spurs
items.summary: Liverpool forward Alexander Isak could be facing a lengthy spell on the sidelines after suffering an injury in his team's Premier League clash with Tottenham Hotspur.

items.title: Arsenal land Christmas No 1! Arteta has ‚Äòbelief and confidence‚Äô in title bid
items.summary: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta insisted being top at Christmas again gave him belief and confidence to finally turn that advantage into success.

items.title: Calvert-Lewin scores twice as Leeds thrash Crystal Palace
items.summary: Dominic Calvert-Lewin extends his scoring streak to five Premier League games with a superb double as Leeds United secure a comfortable victory over Crystal Palace at Elland Road.

items.title: Gyokores penalty sends Arsenal top of the table in win against Everton
items.summary: Arsenal striker Viktor Gyokores' first-half penalty sends the Gunners to the top of the Premier League table in win over Everton.

items.title: Haaland scores twice as Man City beat West Ham
items.summary: Erling Haaland scores twice to help Manchester City beat beleaguered West Ham United for a fifth straight Premier League victory which moved them top of the table.
